This object defines a financial services agreement component detailing the circumstances under which a benefit (money or services) will be paid. Effectively this provides protection against a particular risk. In property insurance, coverage identifies elements such as perils insured against, properties covered, locations covered, individuals insured and the limits of indemnification. In life insurance, a coverage identifies elements such as living and death benefits.
For packages, this will contain the list of coverages in the package.

properties.name: individualPremiums
properties.description: Premiums associated to a sub-component of the coverage (eg a limit or indicator)

amount

properties.description: This specifies the unit of measure for a number of units. This can hold such values as miles, miles per hour, horsepower, CC, inches, feet, meters, kilometers, etc.

This object defines a financial services agreement component detailing the circumstances under which a benefit (money or services) will be paid. This object defines a financial services agreement component detailing the circumstances under which a benefit (money or services) will be paid. Effectively this provides protection against a particular risk. In property insurance, coverage identifies elements such as perils insured against, properties covered, locations covered, individuals insured and the limits of indemnification. In life insurance, a coverage identifies elements such as living and death benefits. This is selected coverages.

coverages
properties.description: This object defines a financial services agreement component detailing the circumstances under which a benefit (money or services) will be paid. properties.name: insurerName

properties.name: lengthTimeWithPreviousInsurer

properties.name: number
properties.description: The policy number assigned to an existing or in process policy, used for reference.

properties.name: reasonCode
properties.description:
A reason used to identify the why the driver didn't have prior, no insurance, other insurance.
* Active Military - No Insurance - This for the driver was active part of the military.
* Cancelled or Lapsed - No Insurance - This is for driver with cancelled or with do not renewed insurance
* Did Not Own a Vehicle - No Insurance - This for the driver didn't own a vehicle.
* Driving Without Insurance - No Insurance - This is when driver is driving without insurance.
* First Owned Car - No Prior - This for the driver first car.
* Lived Overseas - No Insurance - This for the driver was living overseas.
* Not Driving - No Insurance - This for the driver was not driving a car.
* Previous Company Car - No Insurance - This for the driver had a company car prior.
* Vehicle Not Operational - No Insurance - This for the driver owned a vehicle though it didn't operate.

properties.name: typeCode
properties.description:
Type of Other of Prior Policies.
* No Insurance - This is customer that has no insurance, but has driven a car before. Needs to be selected with one of these reason codes - Active Military, Cancelled or Lapsed, Did Not Own a Vehicle, Driving Without Insurance, Lived Overseas, Not Driving, Previous Company Car, Vehicle Not Operational
* No Prior - This is customer that has no prior insurance because they have never driven before. Needs to be selected with one of these reason code First Owned Car.
* Other - This is customer that has other active line of business policies.
* Prior - This is customer that has prior for a certain line of business policies.

This aggregate contains pertinent information about policies related to 'this' policy, such as prior policy history information, other policies in force, or underlying policy information associated with an umbrella or excess policy. This aggregate may be repeated as many times as needed to contain the appropriate prior policy history or other policy information.

An insurance score is a credit rating used by insurance companies to assess a potential insured consumer's level of risk. The insurance score is one of the primary determinants in how much insurance premium the consumer will be assessed.

properties.name: coverages
properties.description: This object defines a financial services agreement component detailing the circumstances under which a benefit (money or services) will be paid. Effectively this provides protection against a particular risk. In property insurance, coverage identifies elements such as perils insured against, properties covered, locations covered, individuals insured and the limits of indemnification. In life insurance, a coverage identifies elements such as living and death benefits. This is selected coverages.

properties.name: id
properties.description: This is the unique identifier for this specific driver instance.

properties.name: licenses
id
properties.description: This is a unique identifier for this specific license instance.

properties.name: licensedDate
properties.description: The original date on which a license was issued.

properties.name: number
properties.description: The license identifier as issued by the regulating jurisdiction. Examples include a producer's state license number, a driver's license number, or a vehicle's license plate number in the United States.

properties.name: stateOrProvinceCode
properties.refDescription: Geographical location where the license was issued.

properties.name: typeCode
properties.description: Type of License. Each Jurisdiction assigns licenses based on their own criteria. The element defines the type of the license.

The license information for each license for a producer or a product provider.Licenses are issued by state. Some states require separate licensing for soliciting and selling. It is not uncommon for an agent in one state to also be licensed in bordering states.

properties.name: typeCode
properties.description:
A code to clarify the driver's relationship to the policy if the relationship is informational in nature (e.g. excluded driver, unlicensed driver, etc.).
LAM Safeco Value Safeco Code Liberty Value Liberty Code Description
Deferred Deferred (MA) D Deferred (MA) 04 Deferred driver means they will not be a covered operator on your policy this can be because they have their own & separate auto insurance policy or they do not have a valid drivers license.
Excluded Excluded / Driver Affidavit (KS) E Restricted 03 Excluded driver refers to a driver whom you ask your auto insurance company not to cover.
This can be used to exclude a problem operator who is not a named insured from an account when. Required by state or provincial law in lieu of terminations or Used to save a long-term policyholder otherwise subject to termination, where permitted by law
Rated Rated R Listed 01 A rated driver is a member of your household who is of driving age and covered by the policy when using the insured car(s).
Unrated Non-Rated Listed(CA/NY/NC/VA) N Unlisted 02 As soon as your young driver's gets a permit, you should call your agent. They will be added to your policy as a non-rated driver. This means there is coverage if they are involved in an accident but you are not charged for them being listed on your policy

PersonalLines - This is more of proprietary code for ISO. - https://www.verisk.com/insurance/about/faq/iso-s-symbols-for-individual-makes-and-models-of-cars/

Business Business BU Business 3
Business Use (Deprecated) Business Use 8
Clergy Clergy man CL
Commercial Commercial H
Commute Commute COM Commute 2
Commute Out of State (Deprecated) Commute Out of State 7
Drive To Work School Over Work School Over 3

Driven To and From School School E
Driven To and From Work To From Work DW
Farm Farm 9 Farm 4
Farm or Ranch (Deprecated) Farm or Ranch FM
For Hire For Hire FH
Government Government GV Government/Federal 5
Other Other None 10

Pleasure PL (Deprecated) PleasurePL PL
Service Delivery SR
Transportation Network Company (Deprecated) TNC 11
